title: Erythema Multiforme: Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Characteristics
short_description: Clinical document describing erythema multiforme, a hypersensitivity disorder affecting children and young adults with characteristic symmetric red lesions.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of erythema multiforme (EM), a group of hypersensitivity disorders primarily affecting children and young adults. The document details the characteristic presentation of symmetric red, patchy lesions on the arms and legs, discusses potential triggering factors including herpes simplex virus, medications (anticonvulsants, sulfonamides, NSAIDs, antibiotics), and infectious organisms like Mycoplasma pneumoniae. It covers the epidemiology showing slight male predominance, age distribution patterns, and diagnostic approaches based on the distinctive target lesion characteristics including size, shape, color, and distribution patterns.
